snippet.title: Here's a glance around the sports grounds
snippet.content: THERE'S plenty happening on the Sunshine Coast sports scene. Here's a few things you may not know about. MX title chance MOTOR SPORT: The 10th and final round of the MX Nationals will be held at Coolum Beach later this month but the prized MX1 title could be claimed at the penultimate round on the Darling Downs on Sunday. "Dean Ferris, our defending champ, mathematically speaking has the opportunity to wrap up the title at Toowoomba which hasn't happened for a number of years," series promoter Kevin Williams said. Hodgson triumphs SAILING: James Hodgson has won the Club Marine NSW Youth Match Racing Championship which was held on Sydney Harbour. Racing with a new crew combination drawn from the Cruising Yacht Club of Australia's youth academy, the 18-year-old had to battle Sydney skipper Tom Grimes to win two-up in the best of three final. The Sunshine Coast youth team of Taylor Rogers with crew Eamon Kriz and Sarah Johnson finished in ninth place out of the 10 national teams. Rankings change SURFING: Keely Andrew has lost a spot on the Championship Tour standings following the seventh of 10 events. She's 12th and is outside the automatic cut-off for re-qualifying for 2017 (the top-10). Andrew was 13th at the event at the US Open of Surfing, which was won by Sage Erickson. The American beat Hawaii's Tatiana Weston-Webb in the final. Australian Tyler Wright leads the rankings. State selection HOCKEY: Buderim duo Alex Breytenbach, Dean Ryan and Eudlo's Angus Sinclair are in the Queensland under-18 men's squad after outstanding performances at the state championships at Toowoomba. The squad is set to be put through its paces at trials in February, when a final team will be announced for the Australian championships in April. Queensland event GYMNASTICS: Club members from the Sunshine Coast will compete at state championships on the Gold Coast this weekend. Showtime Aerobic competitors will take part in aerobic events while YMCA Caloundra contenders will be in rhythmic sections. myDynamics Aerobic members will compete in trampoline divisions. Night of crashes rounds out weekend of heartbreak on Coast roads BREAKING: New festival coming to the Sunshine Coast Major crime spike hits local residents and businesses in small town Coast's vulnerable better off amid plans to build affordable rentals Sunshine Coast Jazz Club is set to present Diamonds of Swing Caloundra Chorale and Theatre Co is gearing up for The Secret Garden Box of Birds art exhibition is coming to Art Nuvo, Buderim A NATIONAL exhibition of ceramic art has been launched on the Coast ONE of Hollywood's most adorable couples is over. New celebrity cooking show fails to fire for Seven. The legendary creator isn't so sure about how Netflix works. *WARNING this story contains spoilers* TARA Reid reveals what's coming in the next installment of TV movie. Garth Prowd's vision made huge impact on Sunshine Coast community Home sells in just one day Winners in Master Builders regional housing and construction awards Ray and Gert will celebrate 70 years of marrive this week
